title: Youtube full screen problem
content: Whenever I try to full screen a Youtube video a large solid white bar will appear on the bottom of my screen. It doesn't block the actual video or even the controls but it seems to push the entire video upwards. It only does this on firefox and only on youtube. It seems to be a solid empty space as I can't click on it and right clicking just gives me video playing options. I've tried restarting my computer and firefox a few times and that didn't work. It does however change size and with the browser zoom and color mode respectively. please help.
creator: ned8

title: comment écrire sur la zone de recherche centrale et non sur l'url

title: Selenide IDE (plugin) isn't working anymore since update of firefox
content:
For testing I use Selenide IDE plugin in the latest Firefox.

example Command to login-> Command: Type Taget: id=mat-input-0 (css selector) Value: Superuser (login name)

expected: In mat-input-0 the value Superuser entered (like running for 4 years now) Actual: Failed: 10:09:07 n.createEvent(...).initKeyEvent is not a function

Selenide ide code isn't changed for years: https://github.com/SeleniumHQ/selenium-ide

no workaraound available.
